doc.title: Earnings First Glance: BYD (1211 HK/ 002594 CH): 37%/38% Profit Miss on JPMe/Cons
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/JPM BYD Earniings First Glance 3738 Profit Miss on JPMeConsJPM BYD Earniings First Glance 3738 Profit Miss on JPMeCons_2025-08-29

passages.text: - 2Q25 Results (MISS): BYD 2Q25 NP came in at 6.6bn RMB, 34-37% below JPMe of 10-10.5bn NP. Unit profit came in at \(\sim 6\mathrm{K}\) , \(\sim 34\%\) below JPMe of 9-9.1K, 31.7% below lowest end of buyside survey (8.7K RMB). Gross margin contracted to 16.3% from 20% (3.8% ppt decline QoQ) on pricing war (revenue came in 9% below Cons).

- 1H25 Progress vs full year estimate: 1H25 NP recorded 15.5bn, only 32.3% of 2025 full year JPMe of 48 RMB. # of total vehicle sold in 1H25 was 2.15mn ( \(\sim 44\%\) of 2025 full year JPMe of 4.8mn) Nick revised his full year profit & sales volume by \(\sim 5\%\) on Aug 13. Latest buyside view on full year-delivery was 4.5mn units below.

- Sentiment likely remain muted: With China overall auto industry sales momentum likely turning YoY negative as early as Sep/Oct to see monthly sales largely falling below seasonality in 2H25 (negative industry beta) till yr-end to see front-loaded demand before subsidy expiry, it is likely sentiment over BYD remain muted with limited near-term catalyst.

- Investors Sentiment & SI est: With both BYD-H & BYD-A underperforming index by 10% for H Line, 15.8% for A Line 3Q25 quarter-to-date, investors were disengaging BYD despite muted sentiment mainly due to strong liquidity driven HKCN market recently. To reflect that, BYD-H SI est was -2.8% WoW, -15% MoM, 7.6X DTC. However, it looks like debate on its realistic 2025/2026 earnings and volume est likely come back with company only achieving \(\sim 1 / 3\) of 2025 full year profit est/44% of BBG cons volume delivery est, with cons looking at 6.1mn deliveries in 2026 compared to Nick Lai's 5.6mn units (9% below Cons).
- Nick Lai rates BYD OW with PT of HKS180/RMB 145. Nick's latest note on BYD - Buckle up before deceleration or decline in 2H25
Joann Kim - Specialist Sales - APAC Industrials & Autos AC
